Module jtrim.executor
Package org.jtrim2.executor

Interface FullQueueHandler

public interface FullQueueHandler
Defines a handler to create a custom exception, when a thread pool finds its task queue full. The handler may block and wait, but note that then it will block the thread trying to submit a task.

Thread safety

Instances of this interface must assume that they might be called from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Instances of this interface must either be synchronization transparent (recommended), or consider all the scenarios from where a task can be submitted to the executor they are associated with.
See Also:
  • ThreadPoolBuilder.setFullQueueHandler

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static FullQueueHandler
    blockAlwaysHandler()
    Returns a handler never producing a failure, and thus always instructing the executor to block and wait.
    RuntimeException
    tryGetFullQueueException(CancellationToken cancelToken)
    Creates an exception to be thrown to signal that the executor queue is full, or returns null to instruct the executor to block and wait until it can execute the task.

  • Method Details

    • blockAlwaysHandler

      static FullQueueHandler blockAlwaysHandler()
      Returns a handler never producing a failure, and thus always instructing the executor to block and wait.
      Returns:
      a handler never producing a failure, and thus always instructing the executor to block and wait. This method never returns null.

    • tryGetFullQueueException

      RuntimeException tryGetFullQueueException(CancellationToken cancelToken)
      Creates an exception to be thrown to signal that the executor queue is full, or returns null to instruct the executor to block and wait until it can execute the task. This method is only called in the event when a full queue was actually observed for a task. Also, this method will not be called twice for the same task submission.

      The exception created (or thrown) will be propagated to the code trying to submit the task.

      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken signalling cancellation if the currently blocking task was canceled or if the executor was shutdown with cancellation. This argument can never be null.
      Returns:
      the exception to be thrown to signal that the executor queue is full, or null to instruct the executor to block and wait until it can execute the task
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - this method might throw an exception, which is effectively the same as returning the exception
